This module contains support to manipulate process.

Procs

proc `$`(x: Process): string {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
The stringify operator for a process. 
proc `==`(x, y: Process): bool {.borrow, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks for equality between two process. 
proc getCommandLine(process: Process): string {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the command line of a process. 
proc getCurrentProcess(): Process {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc getHandle(process: Process): DWORD {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the Win32 process ID (PID) from the specified process. 
proc getName(process: Process): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc getPath(process: Process): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets the path of a process. 
proc getPriority(process: Process): ProcessPriority {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the priority of a process. 
proc getProcess(name: string): Process {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Returns the process of specified name or InvalidProcess if not found. 
proc getStats(process: Process): ProcessStats {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Returns Memory and IO infos of a running process. 
proc isExists(process: Process): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks to see if a specified process exists. 
proc isProcessExists(name: string): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Checks to see if a specified process exists. 
proc isWow64(process: Process): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Determines whether the specified process is running under WOW64 or an Intel64 of x64 processor. 
proc kill(process: Process): bool {.discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [],
                                    forbids: [].}
Terminates a process. 
proc killProcess(name: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Terminates all processes with the same name. 
proc repr(x: Process): string {....raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect],
                                forbids: [].}
Returns string representation of a process. 
proc resume(process: Process): bool {.discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [],
                                      forbids: [].}
Resume a process. 
proc run(path: string; workingDir = ""; options: set[ProcessOption] = {}): Process {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Runs an external program. Returns the process or InvalidProcess if error occured. 
proc runAs(path: string; username: string; password: string; domain = "";
           workingDir = ""; options: set[ProcessOption] = {}): Process {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Runs an external program under the context of a different user. Returns the process or InvalidProcess if error occured. 
proc runAsWait(path: string; username: string; password: string; domain = "";
               workingDir = ""; options: set[ProcessOption] = {}; timeout = 0.0): DWORD {.
    discardable, ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Runs an external program under the context of a different user and pauses execution until the program finishes. Returns exit code of the process or STILL_ACTIVE(259) if timeout reached. 
proc runWait(path: string; workingDir = ""; options: set[ProcessOption] = {};
             timeout = 0.0): DWORD {.discardable, ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [],
                                     forbids: [].}
Runs an external program and pauses execution until the program finishes. Returns exit code of the process or STILL_ACTIVE(259) if timeout reached. 
proc setPriority(process: Process; priority: ProcessPriority): bool {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Changes the priority of a process. 
proc shellExecute(file: string; parameters = ""; workingdir = ""; verb = "";
                  show: ProcessOption = poShow): Process {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API. 
proc shellExecuteWait(file: string; parameters = ""; workingdir = ""; verb = "";
                      show: ProcessOption = poShow; timeout = 0.0): DWORD {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Runs an external program using the ShellExecute API and pauses script execution until it finishes. Returns exit code of the process or STILL_ACTIVE(259) if timeout reached. 
proc stderrRead(process: Process; peek = false): string {....raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Reads from the STDERR stream of a previously run child process. 
proc stdinWrite(process: Process; data: string): int {.discardable,
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Writes to the STDIN stream of a previously run child process. 
proc stdioClose(process: Process; options: set[ProcessOption] = {}) {.
    ...raises: [KeyError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Closes resources associated with a process previously run with STDIO redirection. 
proc stdoutRead(process: Process; peek = false): string {....raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Reads from the STDOUT stream of a previously run child process. 
proc suspend(process: Process): bool {.discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [],
                                       forbids: [].}
Suspend a process. 
proc waitClose(process: Process; timeout = 0.0): DWORD {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Pauses until a given process does not exist. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0.0) is to wait indefinitely. Returns exit code of the process or STILL_ACTIVE(259) if timeout reached. 
proc waitProcess(name: string; timeout = 0.0): Process {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Pauses until a given process exists. timeout specifies how long to wait (in seconds). Default (0.0) is to wait indefinitely. Returns the process or InvalidProcess if timeout reached.

Iterators

iterator allWindows(process: Process): Window {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Iterates over all windows that created by the specified process. 
iterator processes(): tuple[name: string, process: Process] {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Iterates over all processes. 
iterator processes(name: string): Process {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Iterates over process of specified name.

Example:

proc example() =
  for process in processes("notepad.exe"):
    waitClose(process)
iterator windows(process: Process): Window {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Iterates over all top-level windows that created by the specified process.

Made with Nim.
